text: "I often complain of my own misfortunes, not so that they may have pity on me", says Luder, "but because of the infinite love I have for my fellowman". I've noticed that people sleep more peacefully crouched by the music of another misfortune. Finished by Luder, 1989
title: Dichos de Luder 37
author: Julio Ramón Ribeyro
